This course is designed for professionals working with children aged 0  8 in a range of settings including health
column4: education and childcare. In a post Every Child Matters environment
column5: there is a recognition that professionals need to be able to work together to provide the best care and education for young children. This programme draws on expertise from across the field to provide a holistic view of early childhood and young childrens needs.

column1: Successful completion of the programme leads to the award of Foundation Degree and the opportunity to progress to an honours degree
Taught sessions will include a balance of lecture and practical workshops
column2: creating links between theory and practice. The programme will consist of six (20 credit) modules per year. At level 1 core modules will include child development
column4: the developing personality and the role of play.

column1: Students will be expected to develop professional and academic skills as well as personal development plans through elements of each module. At level 2 there will be core and optional modules to allow for some specialism. Modules will include inhibitors to development
column4: parents and carers; as well as options related to early years management and research.
